Keywords: Armor , Avengers , Detective , Scientist , Stark Industries
Real Name: Tony Stark
Special Powers
WEAPONIZED ROBOT ANTS: At the beginning of the game, generate a Robot Ant bystander [MAX 4]. // When Invincible Ant-Man hits with a range attack, after resolutions generate a Robot Ant bystander [MAX 4] in a square adjacent to a hit target.
I AM ANT-MAN: FREE: Choose one. Invincible Ant-Man can use the chosen effects until he chooses again. Protected: Pulse Wave:
*Super Senses, modify defense +1
*Standard damage symbol, modify attack and damage +1.
GOING OUT IN AN ELECTRIC BLAZE OF GLORY: Pulse Wave. When Invincible Ant-Man uses it, you may choose to use it as if he also occupied the squares of all his Robot Ant bystanders. If you do, if there are three or more Robot Ant bystanders on the map, hit characters are dealt 2 damage instead of 1 and after resolutions KO all his Robot Ant bystanders.
THIS IS MY LAST CHANCE: STOP. Toughness.

December 30, 2022
Oathful
I've actually been toying with that idea Bobcat. I've found one fairly fun combo: running #058 White Sword allows all bystanders to use Charge if he hits with his own Charge. Have your ants on standby, hit with White Sword, then Charge all your ants in. Then, detonate them with Ant-Man. It's led to some pretty fun nukes the few times I've tried it in online games. White Sword even allows you to revive two of the ants if you want. The price is your theme team, but you get a lot of mileage out of this if you're willing to forgo those bonuses
December 30, 2022
Bobcat2022
Pulled this guy from a random boosterâ€¦ someone has to have broken this piece, right? Remote Pulse Wave through generated bystanders seems severely exploitable, especially if each successful use means another Robot Ant next to the targets. Whole thing gives me WatX Fantomex/pre-nerf Iron Pharaoh vibes (even if Pulse Wave itself has been nerfed since then). Any way to zip these ants around the board nowadays, Spiral portals or something?
October 24, 2022
Oathful
If I had a penny for everytime I saw an amazing Scientist dial and thought, "Man, I wish I could run this guy with my Robot team, since they use robots all the time", I'd have a lot of pennies. Regardless, this prime looks really nice, good stats, fun powers, and his bystanders having flying while being autonomous is always a big bonus, and means that Tony here can ride his ants (suck it Scott Lang dials). Being able to use Pulse Wave from the ants is both really cool and adds a skill ceiling to how you manuver your ants. You could just straight up "throw" a Pulse Wave at someone, you could surround the entire opposing team with ants and fry them for higher damage, or they could serve as a distraction as your opponents try and destroy your ants while you set up a bigger play. That and the fact that Tony's dial is really good without the ants, this guy is probably my favorite prime and a must grab out of this set. // Thematic: 9.5/10, Viability: 8-10/10 (mileage may vary), Fun Factor: 10/10, leans towards biased-fun.
